Title: Example Variable 1 - Categorical
Description: Please delete this entry: Categorical_Ex1 is an example entry for a categorical variable (e.g. species, sex, etc).

Title: Example Variable 2 - Molecular
Description: Please delete this entry: Mol_Ex2 is an example entry for a quantitative measurement.

Title: Example Variable 3 - Ordinal
Description: Please delete this entry: Ordinal_Ex3 is an example entry for an ordinal variable (could be numeric but not continuous).

Title: Example Variable 4 - Date
Description: Please delete this entry: example Date entry (e.g. injury surgery date).

Title: Example Variable 5 - Free Text
Description: Please delete this entry: example Free Text entry (e.g. 'Notes' column in the dataset).

Title: Subject identifier
Description: Unique identifiers for each subject in the dataset

Title: Species
Description: Species of the subject

Title: Strain
Description: Strain of the subject
Comments: Required for publication with option of 'unknown' or 'not available'

Title: Vendor or origin of the animal
Description: Vendor or origin of the animal
Comments: Required for publication; Set to 'not available' if data is not present

Title: Age of the subject
Description: Age of the subject at start of experiment. If age is available at different timepoints, age is provided at the corresponding time in the XXX time variable
Comments: Required for publication; Set to 'not available' if data is not present

Title: Weight of the subject
Description: Weight of the subject at start of experiment. If weight is available at different timepoints, weight is provided at the corresponding time in the XXX time variable
Comments: Required for publication; Set to 'not available' if data is not present

Title: Sex of the subject
Description: Sex of the subject

Title: Experimental group
Description: Name or identifier of the experimental group at which the subject was included if any
Comments: Required for publication; Set to 'not applicable' if  do not apply

Title: Laboratory name
Description: Name of laboratory, usually the PI

Title: Study leader
Description: Name of person responsible for overseeing project
Comments: Required for publication; Set to 'not available' if data is not present or do not want to disclosure

Title: Whether the study was published
Description: General category of whether the study was published/in press, under review/pre-press, or unpublished.

Title: Whether the subject was excluded in the originating study
Description: Whether the subject was included in the study that originated the data. 'Total exclusion" if excluded from the entire study, otherwise, specify experiment or measures of which the animal was excluded if any. For example: animals that were run in behavior but maybe tissue is loss and excluded from histological analyses. Reasons forexclusion might be specify in the exclusion_reason variable.

Title: Reason or creteria for exluding subject from originating study
Description: Reason by which the subject was excluded from the study that originated the data as specified in the Exclusion_in_origin_study variable

Title: Cause of subject death
Description: Cause of death (e.g. perfusion/necropsy, died during surgery, euthanized for health reasons, etc)
Comments: Required for publication; Set to 'not applicable' if  do not apply

Title: Type or model of injury
Description: Type or model of injury used in the subject (e.g. contusion, complete transaction, partial section)
Comments: Required for publication; Set to 'not applicable' if  do not apply

Title: Device used for injury
Description: Name of the device used for the injury
Comments: Required for publication; Set to 'not applicable' if  do not apply

Title: Spinal cord level of the injury
Description: Spinal cord level at which the injury was performed including segment (e.g. cervical; C) and number (e.g. C5)
Comments: Required for publication; Set to 'not applicable' if  do not apply

Title: Other details referent to injury
Description: Other details referent to the injury that might be relevant to understand the severity and type of injury performed
Comments: Required for publication; Set to 'not applicable' if  do not apply
